description: GRDDL is a technique for gleaning resource descriptions from dialects of languages. It's a way of extracting Semantic Web data in RDF from XML formats (especially XHTML dialects or [microformats](http://www.microformats.org/)) via transformations identified by URIs and typically expressed in XSLT. For full details, see the [GRDDL specification](http://www.w3.org/2003/g/data-view#grddl_spec).
label: GRDDL Data Views

InformationResource.description: A resource which has the property that all of its essential characteristics can be conveyed in a message
InformationResource.label: InformationResource

RootNode.description: the root of the tree in the XPath data model
RootNode.label: RootNode

Transformation.description: an InformationResource that specifies a transformation from a set of XML documents to RDF graphs
Transformation.label: Transformation

TransformationProperty.description: a FunctionalProperty that relates XML document root nodes to RDF graphs
TransformationProperty.label: TransformationProperty

namespaceTransformation.description: relates a namespace to a transformation for all documents in that namespace
namespaceTransformation.label: namespaceTransformation

profileTransformation.description: relates a profile document to a transformation for all documents bearing that profile
profileTransformation.label: profileTransformation

result.description: an RDF graph obtained from an information resource by directly parsing a representation in the standard RDF/XML syntax or indirectly by parsing some other dialect using a transformation nominated by the document
result.label: result

transformation.description: relates a source document to a transformation, usually represented in XSLT, that relates the source document syntax to the RDF graph syntax
transformation.label: transformation
